label: cor-closed-form-lipschitz-composite
name: Closed-form bound for L_{g_A∘z} (empirical aggregator)
natural_language_statement: For the empirical aggregator, the composite map for the standardized score, g_A ∘ z, is globally Lipschitz. Its Lipschitz constant has a closed-form bound that depends on the properties of the cubic patch, the regularized standardization, walker velocities, and the number of walkers.
description: This corollary provides the final closed-form Lipschitz bound for the entire standardization and rescaling pipeline (g_A ∘ z) when using the empirical aggregator. This is a key result for proving the continuity of the fitness potential operator.
assumptions_hypotheses: The number of active walkers is $k=|\mathcal A(\mathcal S)|$.
The empirical aggregator from §6.2.2.a is used.
The regularized standardization and piecewise rescale from §8.2.2 are used.
conclusion_main_result: The composite map $g_A \circ z$ is globally Lipschitz with constant $L_{g_A\circ z} \le \max\{\,L_P,\,1\,\} \cdot \frac{2 L_{\sigma'_{\text{reg}}} V_{\max}}{\sqrt{k}}$.

relations.description: Establishes a global Lipschitz bound for the composite map g_A ∘ z under the specified conditions.
